Data Anlaytics

  • See if you can draw a Graph on when to use and what they dd

Kineses Data Streams

  • Concept
    • it is a scalable STREAMING service
    • Producers send data into a Kineses Stream
    • Public Service & HA by design
    • Store 24 hour moving Window
      • Window can be increase to max 365 days
    • Consumer can access the data in this window
  • Structure
    • Producers:
      • e.g. IoT, mobile…
    • Consumers:
      • e.g. Lambda/Server
  • Underthe hood:
    • Shard Architecture
      • each shard is 1 MB Ingestion/2MB Consumption
      • Data Record
    • Window (24 hour to 365)
      • Persistent Storage
  • Comparison to SQS
    • SQS = 1 Production Group + 1 Consumption Group
      • Mostly Decoupling and Asynchornous Communications
      • No Persistence of messages, no Window
    • Kinesis = N Production Group + N Consumption Group
      • Ingestion/Analytics/Monitoring/App Clicks
      • Rolling Window

Kineses Data Firehose

  • Concept:
    • Kinesis Data Stream does not persist data (like SQS)
    • Firehose’s goal is to load data for Data Lakes/Stores/Analytics service (e.g. S3)
  • Structure:
    • Fully Managed
    • Supports Near Real Time Transofmr with Lambda
  • Under the Hood:
    • Work with Kinesis Data Stream/Any data streaming
    • Buffers the streamed data. in size of MB (e.g.1) or Seconds (60 seconds)
    • Transform the data during buffer
    • Then store to the destination

Kinesis Data Analytics

  • Concept:
    • Real time Processing of Data that is been streamed
    • Using SQL
    • Igests only from Kinesis Data Streams/Firehose
  • Structure:
    • Fits between INPUT and OUTPUT
    • Perform live analytics on the INPUT, and transform to OUTPUT
  • Under the hood:
    • Input: Take Stream/Firehose/S3 as input
    • Output: Kinesis Stream/Firehouse
  • Situation:
    • Real-time SQL Processing
    • Timeseries ANalytics
    • Leaderboards for games
    • Security and Response teams

MapReduce

  • Frame work for Large scale parallel processing of large datasets
  • Structure:
    • Maps phase and Reduce Phase
      • Divide and concur
      • Afterward it re-combined back
  • Under the hood
    1. Map
    2. Split
    3. Shuffle Cause each split might have the same key
    4. Reduce
    5. Final Output
  • Hadoop File System
    • Stored across multiple Data nodes
    • Highly Fault Tolerant and replicated between Nodes
    • Name Node
    • Block -> Segment of data, generally 64 MB

EMR Architecture

  • Concept:
    • Managed Implementation of Apache Hadoop
      • Spark, HBase,Presto, Flink, Hive, Pig
    • Can be operated Long Term or use Ad-Hoc
    • For Big Data Processing -> Data Pipline
  • Structure:
    • Runs One AZ in a VPC using EC2 for comput
    • AUto Scales - Spot/InstanceFleet/Reserved/On Demand
  • Under the Hood:
    • Load input data from S3 and output to S3
    • Every cluster has at least 1 node, the master node
      • M Node manages the cluster and its health
      • M Node distribute Health
      • Now you can run 3 M NOde
        • If M Node fail, then it will be an issue
    • Cluster have Core Nodes
      • Act as a data nodes for HDFS
      • Run task trackers and can run mapping and reduce
      • HDFS is a storage linked to the life cycle of the cluster
      • Managed by Core nodes, can fail if core node fails
      • NOT REGIONALLY RESILIENT
    • Optional - TASK NODES
      • Only run tasks
      • Does not impact HDFS if afail
      • Ideal for SPOT based Scaling
    • EMRFS
      • Persist past EMR
      • runs on S3

Redshift Architecture

  • Concept:
    • Petabyte Scale Data Warehouse
    • NOT FOR OPERATION STYLE USAGE
    • OLAP (Column based database)
    • Pay As You Use ( Similar to RDS )
    • Direct Query S3 using REDSFHIT SPECTRUM
    • Direct Query DBs using Federated Query
    • Integrates with AWS Tooling like Quicksight
    • SQL Like Injection
    • Server base (not serverless)
  • Structure:
    • Load from DDB/DBs, Firehose..e.tc
  • Under the Hood:
    • Cluster based
    • Runs in One AZ in a VPC (not Highly available by design)
    • Leader Node and Compute Node
    • VPC Security, IAM Permissions, KMS at rest Encryption, CW Monitoring
    • Redshift Enhanced VPC routing - VPC Networking
    • Backup is done to S3 Automatically (You can also do it manually)
    • Nodes have slices
  • Redshift Resilience and Recovery
    • Utilize S3 as Backup
      • Automatically incremental Backups
      • 1 day retention
    • Replicated across other AZs

AWS Batch

  • Situation
    • Managed batch processing compute service
    • Used for long running/resource heavy compute services at Scale
      • e.g. Process that is > 15minutes (Lambda Limit)
    • Jobs that can run without end user interaction
    • Let you define jobs, and AWS handle Compute/Decision
  • Under the hood
    • Job
      • Script/Executable/Docker Container submitted to Batch
      • Based on Container
    • Job Definition
      • Meta Data for a JOB, e..g IAM/Resource Config…
    • Job Queue
      • Jobs are submitted to a queue where they wait for compute
    • Compute Environment
      • Managed/Unmanaged
      • You can cofgiure ideal instance or you provide compute you mangage
    • When Job finished
      • Metadata in DDB/other
      • Data in S3/other
      • You can also link to other, e.g. Step Function/State machine..etc
  • Comparison
    • Lambda:
      • Has 15 minute execution time limit
      • Limited disk space in the environment
      • EFS can be used, but you need to run in VPC
      • fully serverless but limited runtime selection
    • Batch
      • NOT Serverless
      • Use docker and ANY runtime
      • Not Time limit or effective resource limit
  • MANAGED VS UNMANAGED
    • Managed:
      • Aws batch manage capacity based on worloads
      • Ondemand vs Spot
      • Max Spot PRice…etc
      • VPC Private/Public Requires VPC Gateway
        • You need to configure accessibility
    • Unmanaged
      • You manage everything
        • e.g. You have full compute due to cost consideration

AWS QuickSight

  • Sitation
    • BA/BI service
    • Vislaization
    • Cost Effective Solution comparing to others
    • Discovery/Integration
    • Works with external data source
  • Structure
    • Data Source connect to Quick Sights
    • Prepare and do visualization/analysis
  • Supports:
    • Athena/Aurora/Redshift/Redshift Spectrum
    • S3/AWS IOT
    • JIRA, GITHUB, TWITTER, SALESFORCE
    • MSSQL, MySQL, PostgresSQl
    • Apache Spark, Snowflak, Presto,Teradata
